title: The Circle recap: Sammie and Paddy plot to take down Ella
text:
The game is getting savage and we’re here for it (Picture: Channel 4)

The Circle’s lost another member of the squad as Woody dealt the fatal blow on 62-year-old Joyce – only to get a shock when he discovered it was actually Jack and Beth.

But that was the least of their worries as the game got ramped up to 11 as the strategy of the players began to be revealed – with less than a week to go and £100k in their sights, it was clear what everyone was aiming for.

Missed tonight’s episode? Here’s everything you need to know.

Woody got a shock when he went to block ‘Joyce’ (Picture: Channel 4)

Ta-Ra from Joyce

In a series first, Woody had to meet with the pair to tell them that they were blocked with the game…but the actual reveal for all three of them was perfect GIF material.

Advertisement

Advertisement

As Jack explained what happened to get them back in the game, Woody came clean about his famous parents.

Beth seemed less than happy about their axe, but softened when Woody apologised for blocking them saying he has “special relationships” that he can’t go against.

Before they leave, Jack and Beth reveal their suspicions about Josh and how they think that he’s actually a girl (which they are 100% right about – it’s girl Busayo.)

All the players realised they had survived another blocking with Tim musing, ‘I don’t know who’s gone and I don’t know who’s done it’.

Woody decided it was best not to tell anyone it was him.

Jack and Beth’s romance was clear to everyone (Picture: Channel 4)

‘They’re totes f***ing’

Jack and Beth’s goodbye message makes it clear to everyone that they may have become a couple.

The first Circle is officially in effect ladies and gents!

Paddy seems a bit miffed that he missed his shot at hunky Jack, but the chemistry is clear between the pair as they joke about what’s been going on in their close quarters.

In a private chat with Paddy, Sammie (aka James), and Georgina, Sammie references Jack and Beth’s mention of players seemly dodging questions.

Is Sammie about to up his game to get to the finish line?

Sammie/James wants to up their game to win the money (Picture: Channel 4)

The game gets dangerous

The Circle has given players the chance to explain why they think they deserve to win and who they see as their biggest rival – and most of them say Ella.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Georgina dubbed Ella as “valid competition” because they seem a lot alike and explains that she would use the money to host a Christmas charity ball for charity.

Josh/Busayo sees Tim as ‘his’ rival and says the prize money would be used to build a school for “disadvantaged children”. Tim quickly rebukes this idea stating that the amount needed to build and run a school far “exceeds” the prize fund amount.

Jan chooses Ella and wants the money to seek other opportunities in life as she gets older.

Paddy on the other hand, gets savage and goes after Josh – saying that he’s been vague and doesn’t come across as authentic.

Paddy plots with Sammie to take down the ‘Top Three’ (Picture: Channel 4)

Obviously, not what Busayo wants to hear as it appears she’s been rumbled as not Josh – but even she has to admit that the brutality is amazing.

Serious shots fired guys with the savagery – you have to love it.

However, Busayo later admits that she’s hurt by Tim after he confronts her about plans to open a school with the winnings if she took home the cash.

Busayo is struggling with the pressure of pretending to be Josh – and may have been rumbled (Picture: Channel 4)

Having a heart-to-heart bond with a side order of passive aggressive messages, neither backed down.

Tim later suggests that he knows Josh is fake as well.

Can Busayo bring it back before the end of the game?

More: The Circle The Circle's Jack and Beth confirm romance and are absolutely smitten When is the final of The Circle? The Circle recap: Woody given secret power to block player from the game in savage move

Advertisement

United front

After no one called him the biggest rival of the game, Sammie/James pulls in Paddy for a chat – and the couple come up with a plan to take down the leading competition and ‘dethrone’ Ella.

Dubbing the game a ‘brown nose fest’, Sammie lures Paddy in with her ‘genuine chat’ (with Paddy completely unaware that Sammie’s actually a catfish).

Knowing that Georgina is vulnerable after losing her bestie Brooke, they decide they need to bring her in with a mission to take down the ‘top three’ for good.

‘We’re not going down without a fight, Pammie’s reign have begun,’ Paddy writes.

Game. On.

The Circle airs weeknights and Sunday at 10pm on Channel 4.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

MORE: Taylor Swift’s boyfriend in the Blank Space video is joining The Circle and we’re screaming
description: The Circle is getting savage as catfish are put in hot water, Sammie and Paddy plot to take down rivals, and Jack and Beth start a romance.
